While data visualizations are often computer-generated tables, charts, and graphs, you may also hand-draw them. 
Using color is a simple way to show progress (red to indicate “no” or a negative trend, green to indicate “yes” or a 
positive trend). Below are examples of data visualizations that will help show progress and tell the story of the 
implementation process:
